subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Big Mistake!
author: Zack Widup
full_text:

:-)

On Thu, Dec 31, 2009 at 12:51 PM, don powell <dpowell7299@...> wrote:

>
>
>  I thought the "secret location" was a hoot too.  I mean it is frigging

>

> *From:* Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...>
> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> *Sent:* Thu, December 31, 2009 12:19:21 PM
> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] Big Mistake!
>
>
>
>   Sorry to hear that Frank. I can think of plenty of actual researchers
> who would love to test one and are already getting great results with other
> methods and versions of your work. I am also sorry I didnt make it very far
> past the second paragraph. Karen obviously does not research before she
> writes her articles.
>
> "However, the precise location of the Sanatorium is a closely guarded
> secret."
>
> Ummm Karen needs to learn to use Google as well. If she had she would have
> been able to print out a map to Waverly which includes information such as
> tracks, businesses, adresses AND golf courses at the corner.  It even shows
> you an overhead view of each building you pass along the way on each street.
> Hint to Karen click sattelite view after you explore closeups of map view.
>
> Im sorry but if you are going to write a well informed article the first
> step is become well informed. I wont bother reading the rest of her articles
> because I wont waste my time looking at research from someone who cant
> bother to cover the basics like look at a map before you drive out to
> someplace you've never been before and then misinform people that it is in a
> secret location. Nor do I see walking on a tour as as actual "investigation"
> .
>
> Alot of the people once believed the earth was flat, unfortunately they
> were not "well informed" and they too were victims of shoddy research.
> Luckily there are those who do look beyond the horizon and open their minds
> to the possibility that there is more out there.
>
> Happy New Years everyone and may your journey next year be in the right
> direction!
>
> Misty
>

> other day. I let them "barrow" #63, now  I'm sure she will claim she tested
> the box "scientifically, and can prove it does not work.
>
>  Karen had contacted me via e-mail requesting a meeting. I thought she was
> someone off the group and has an interest in EVP and the boxes. She did
> mention she was a skeptic, but I didn't think debunker, or a professional
> skeptic--wonder who pays these twits?
>
>
>  These skeptics don't allow themselves to hear anything, yet will proclaim
> that as proof the boxes and EVP don't work, as if their hearing is somehow
> better than the average persons ear. If a person doesn't want to hear it,
> they won't, and because they can''t hear EVP that means no one else an
> either.  Yeah, real scientific!
>
>  Gonna have to remember Google-googel- google!!
>
>  Frank-S
